c1.title: Intro to Web Development
c1.description: Learn the fundamentals of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

c2.title: Advanced React
c2.description: Master React hooks, state management, and performance.

c3.title: Data Structures & Algorithms
c3.description: Understand fundamental data structures and algorithms.

as1.title: HTML & CSS Basics
as1.description: Create a simple personal portfolio page.

as3.title: React Hooks
as3.description: Build a todo list app using React Hooks.

as4.title: Big O Notation
as4.description: Analyze the time complexity of given algorithms.

sub1.content: Here is my portfolio. I used flexbox for the layout.
sub1.feedback: Excellent work! Your CSS is clean and your HTML is semantic.

sub2.content: I believe the time complexity is O(n log n).

sub3.feedback: Functionality is there, but the UI could be improved. Also, consider edge cases like division by zero.

po1.content: I'm having trouble centering a div. Can anyone help?

po2.content: Sure! Try using `display: flex; justify-content: center; align-items: center;` on the parent container.

chal1.title: E-commerce Search API
chal1.description: Design and document a RESTful API for an e-commerce platform that allows users to search for products with filters and sorting. Focus on the API contract, not the implementation.

chal2.title: Social Media Feed Algorithm
chal2.description: Propose an algorithm for a social media feed that prioritizes user engagement. Consider factors like recency, user interactions, and content type. Write a whitepaper explaining your approach.

chal3.title: Database Schema for a Booking App
chal3.description: Design a normalized database schema for a hotel booking application. The schema should handle users, hotels, rooms, and bookings. Provide an ERD (Entity-Relationship Diagram).

proj1.title: My Personal Portfolio
proj1.description: A responsive portfolio website built with React and Tailwind CSS to showcase my projects and skills. Features a dark mode toggle and a contact form.

proj2.title: Data Visualization Dashboard
proj2.description: A dashboard for visualizing sales data using D3.js. It includes interactive charts and filters to explore trends over time.

d1.name: Google
d1.description: Tackle a challenge in large-scale systems, search, or cloud computing.

task.title: Design a Scalable URL Shortener
task.scenario: You're an intern on the Google Cloud Platform team. A major client needs to create a highly scalable URL shortening service, similar to bit.ly, that can handle billions of requests per month. They need a high-level technical design proposal before they commit resources.
task.task: Design the system architecture for this service. Consider how you would handle generating unique short URLs, redirecting users, and storing the mapping. Think about scalability, reliability, and analytics.
deliverables: A high-level system diagram showing the main components (e.g., Load Balancer, Web Servers, Database, Caching Layer).
A brief (1-2 paragraphs) explanation of your choice of database (e.g., SQL vs. NoSQL) and why.
Pseudo-code for the function that would generate a unique short code from a long URL.

d2.name: OpenAI
d2.description: Explore the frontiers of AI by designing an application that leverages large language models.

task.title: Develop a Concept for an AI-Powered Code Review Tool
task.scenario: You're interning with the applied engineering team at OpenAI. Your manager wants to explore new applications for GPT-4. You've been tasked with creating a concept proposal for a tool that automates parts of the code review process.
task.task: Conceptualize a tool that integrates with GitHub and uses an LLM to analyze pull requests. The tool should identify potential bugs, suggest improvements for clarity and style, and summarize the changes for the human reviewer. Your focus is on the product features and user experience, not the underlying model.
deliverables: A 1-page proposal outlining the tool's key features and user benefits.
A mock-up or wireframe (can be described in text) of how the tool's feedback would appear in a GitHub pull request.
A sample prompt that you might send to the LLM to analyze a piece of code.

d3.name: Netflix
d3.description: Work on a problem related to content delivery, recommendation systems, or streaming media.

task.title: Algorithm for 'Continue Watching' List
task.scenario: You are on the personalization team at Netflix. The current 'Continue Watching' list is purely chronological. Your team wants to make it smarter by prioritizing content the user is more likely to want to finish.
task.task: Propose a new algorithm for ordering the 'Continue Watching' list. Consider factors like how recently the item was watched, how much of it is left, the type of content (movie vs. series), and user interaction patterns.
deliverables: A list of at least 5 factors (signals) you would use in your algorithm, with a weight or priority for each.
A high-level description of the logic (e.g., a scoring function) that would use these signals to rank the list.
An explanation of one edge case your algorithm handles (e.g., a movie watched 99% of the way through).

d4.name: Microsoft
d4.description: Solve a complex problem in enterprise software, cloud services, or developer tools.

task.title: Feature Proposal for VS Code
task.scenario: You're an intern on the Visual Studio Code team. Your task is to propose a new, innovative feature that would significantly improve developer productivity.
task.task: Identify a common pain point for developers that isn't perfectly solved by existing VS Code features or extensions. Propose a new feature to address it. Your proposal should be convincing enough to be considered for the product roadmap.
deliverables: A short 'press release' (1-2 paragraphs) announcing the new feature and its benefits.
A list of the key user stories this feature would enable.
A description of how you would measure the success or adoption of this feature after launch.

d5.name: AWS
d5.description: Design a cloud-native solution for a common business problem using AWS services.

task.title: Serverless Architecture for Image Processing
task.scenario: A social media startup needs to process user-uploaded images to create thumbnails of different sizes. They want a cost-effective, highly scalable solution on AWS without managing any servers.
task.task: Design a serverless architecture using AWS services to handle this workflow. The process should trigger automatically whenever a new image is uploaded.
deliverables: An architecture diagram showing the flow of data between the chosen AWS services (e.g., S3, Lambda, etc.).
A numbered list explaining the role of each service in the architecture.
A brief explanation of why this serverless approach is better than a traditional server-based one for this use case.

d6.name: Apple
d6.description: Design an intuitive and elegant user experience for a new mobile application feature.

task.title: UX Design for a Collaborative 'Memories' Feature
task.scenario: You are a UX design intern on the Photos app team at Apple. You are tasked with designing a new feature that allows multiple users to contribute photos and videos to a shared 'Memory' album from an event, like a wedding or a vacation.
task.task: Describe the user experience for creating, contributing to, and viewing a collaborative Memory. Focus on making the process seamless, private, and delightful, in line with Apple's design philosophy.
deliverables: A step-by-step user flow for how a user would invite others to a collaborative Memory.
A description of the main screen for viewing a collaborative Memory, highlighting key UI elements.
An explanation of how you would handle privacy and permissions (e.g., who can add photos, who can view).

d7.name: Meta
d7.description: Explore new ways to connect people through social technology or the metaverse.

task.title: Concept for a Hyper-Local Community Feature
task.scenario: You're an intern on the Facebook Groups team. Your group is brainstorming ways to help people connect with their immediate neighbors (e.g., on their street or in their apartment building) more effectively.
task.task: Propose a new feature concept for the Facebook app that facilitates hyper-local community building. Consider features for sharing information, organizing local events, or offering help to neighbors. The key is to balance usefulness with user privacy.
deliverables: A name and a one-sentence tagline for your proposed feature.
A list of the top 3-5 functionalities the feature would offer.
A brief discussion on how you would address potential safety and privacy concerns.
